greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let {c(i)} = A007916 denote the sequence of numbers > 1 which are not perfect powers. Every positive integer n has a unique representation as a tower n = c(x_1)^c(x_2)^c(x_3)^...^c(x_k), where the exponents are nested from the right. The sequence is an irregular triangle read by rows, where the n-th row lists x_1, ..., x_k.
comment: Row lengths are A288636(n). - _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 12 2017
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20181
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 09 2016
